page.title: 04North Street
page.content: {North Street}leading to our school is a terraced street of 31 houses. Arkwright and Strutt, needing housing for their mill labour built it between 1771 and 1780.Houses are liked by their occupants for their thick walls, friendly atmosphere and proximity to schools and shops.Its a good street for children to play on as it is a dead_end leading to a field.People don't like the hordes of tourists "gawping" in their windows.They also would prefer not to see houses on the other side of the street.But the thing they disliked most was no outside alterations are allowed in a conservation area,though many have made internal alterations.Most houses now contain an upstairs bathroom, 3 bedrooms, kichen, lounge.Some now have toilets down stairs.
